title: Shoalhaven City Council indirectly challenged over lack of Green Waste Bins Jun 02, 2018
content: Shoalhaven Mayor Amanda Findley and South Coast MP Shelley Hancock are having a battle with one another over Green Waste bins.    It started a couple of days ago when Ms Hancock posted the question should Shoalhaven City Council introduce a kerbside organic waste collection service.    Ms Hancock saying the State Government has made $8 million in grants available in addition to $19.4 million already allocated to assist Councils with introducing and enhancing kerbside organic bin services.    In Response, Amanda Findley posted she wishes State members would butt out of Councils business, saying public consultation is already underway over the issue.    She's also challenged the State Government to change the classification of Shoalhaven to a rural Council for waste levy purposes.    View more information from Council here:  https://getinvolved.shoalhaven.nsw.gov.au/waste-reduction-management-strategy-2016-2
